                  def handle_accept(application)
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            8
            

            

                    if application.nil?
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            2
            

            

                      render status: 404, json: { message: 'Not found.' }
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            6
            

            

                    elsif application.status != '1'
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            5
            

            

                      application.accept(application_params[:response] || 'ACCEPTED')
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            5
            

            

                      render status: 200, json: { message: 'Application successfully accepted.' }
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            1
            

            

                      render status: 400, json: { message: 'Already accepted.' }
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      146.

                  def handle_reject(application)

    149. 
            8
            

            

                    if application.nil?

    151. 
            6
            

            

                    elsif application.status != '-1'
          
      152.

                class AuthenticationsController < ApiController

                  def create_refresh
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            28
            

            

                    email, password = ActionController::HttpAuthentication::Basic.user_name_and_password(request)
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                    # ============ Are all essential ===============
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            
            

            

                    # ============ credentials there? ==============
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            28
            

            

                    if !email.present? && password.present? # checks for fully missing as well as empty params
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            1
            

            

                      blank_error('email')
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            27
            

            

                    elsif email.present? && !password.present?
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            1
            

            

                      blank_error('password')
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            26
            

            

                    elsif !email.present? && !password.present?
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            1
            

            

                      blank_error(%w[email password])
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                    else
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

            
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            
            

            

                      # ============== Are credentials ===============
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

                      # ================= correct? ===================
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23. 
            25
            

            

                      @user = User.find_by(email:)
          
      24. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    24. 
            25
            

            

                      return unauthorized_error('email|password') if !@user.present? || !@user.authenticate(password)
          
      25. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    25. 
            
            

            

            
          
      26. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    26. 
            
            

            

                      # ============ Token gets claimed ==============
          
      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            24
            

            

                      token = if refresh_token_params['validity'].present? # is a custom token validity interval requested
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

                                AuthenticationTokenService::Refresh::Encoder.call(@user.id, refresh_token_params['validity'])
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

                              else
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            24
            

            

                                AuthenticationTokenService::Refresh::Encoder.call(@user.id)
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                              end
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

            
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            22
            

            

                      render status: 200, json: { 'refresh_token' => token }
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

                    # ========== Rescue severe Exceptions ==========
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            
            

            

                  rescue ActionController::ParameterMissing
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

                    blank_error('refresh_token')
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            
            

            

                    # ======== Overwrite APIExceptionHandler =======
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

                  rescue CustomExceptions::InvalidUser::Unknown
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            
            

            

                    # The requested token subject (User) doesn't exists BUT user.authenticate(refresh_token_params["password"]) says true
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                    render status: 500, json: { error: 'Please try again later. If this error persists, we recommend to contact our support team.' }
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                  rescue CustomExceptions::InvalidInput::SUB
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                    # Invalid Input (User Attribute is malformed) BUT user.authenticate(refresh_token_params["password"]) says true
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                    render status: 500, json: { error: 'Please try again later. If this error persists, we recommend to contact our support team.' }
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

            
          
      47.

                  def create_access
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                    # ============ Token gets claimed ==============
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            23
            

            

                    if request.headers['HTTP_REFRESH_TOKEN'].nil? || request.headers['HTTP_REFRESH_TOKEN'].empty?
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            1
            

            

                      render status: 400, json: { token: [
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

                        {
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                          error: 'ERR_BLANK',

    53. 
            
            

            

                          description: "Attribute can't be blank"
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54.

                  def call_feed(jobs)

                    # url = URI.parse("http://localhost:8080/feed")

                    http.use_ssl = true

      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253.

                class PasswordResetsController < ApiController

                  def create
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            5
            

            

                    if params[:email].present?
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            4
            

            

                      @user = User.find_by(email: params[:email])
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            4
            

            

                      PasswordMailer.with(user: @user).reset.deliver_later if !@user.nil? && user_not_blacklisted(@user.id) && @user.present?

    13. 
            
            

            

            
          
      14.

                  def update

            10
            

            

                    return blank_error('password') if password_blank?

            1
            

            

                    blank_error('user') # should not be thrown
          
      29.

                  rescue ActiveRecord::RecordInvalid # Thrown when password != password_confirmation

                  def update_password

                  def update_or_create_job(job_slug)

    89. 
            
            

            

                    unless @job
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90.

                      @job.user = @client

              def set_current_id(id = nil)
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            219
            

            

                if id.nil?
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            192
            

            

                  raise CustomExceptions::InvalidUser::LoggedOut if Current.user.nil?
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            27
            

            

                  Current.user = User.find_by(id:)
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            27
            

            

                  raise CustomExceptions::InvalidUser::Unknown if Current.user.nil?
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

            
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            1

      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184.

      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

            
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            51

      187.

            def set_notifications
          
      512. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    512. 
            
            

            

              notifications = Notification.includes(:recipient).where(recipient: Current.user).newest_first.limit(9)

              @unread = notifications.unread

              def handle_record_invalid(application_attachment)

            # The ApplicationAttachment class represents an attachment (like a CV)
          
      4.

            # that is associated with a job application in the application.

              def calculate_time_left(diff_seconds)

              def flatten_hash(hash)

                new_hash = {}

                  if value.instance_of?(Hash) && value.present?

      356. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    356.

      360. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    360. 
            
            

            

                        new_hash[key] = v

    361. 
            
            

            

                        break
          
      362.

      363.

                        bin = flatten_hash(v)
          
      364. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    364.

      367.

            # The AuthenticationTokenService class is responsible for generating and decoding JWT tokens.
          
      4.

            1
            

            

            class AuthenticationTokenService
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

              # generates a generic token (=> is used to generate refresh and access token)
          
      6.

              # CAUTION: NO INPUT VERIFICATION ETC. PROVIDED BY THIS METHOD

              def self.call(secret, algorithm, issuer, payload)

    8. 
            51
            

            

                payload['iss'] = issuer.to_s

              class Refresh

                def self.encode(sub, exp, jti, iat)

    22. 
            
            

            

                  # serializes token generation for a refresh token

                def self.decode(token)
          
      30. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    30. 
            
            

            

                  # token decoding for a refresh token
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

                  # this method decodes a jwt token
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            22
            

            

                  decoded_token = JWT.decode(token, HMAC_SECRET, true, { verify_jti: proc { |jti|
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            21
            

            

                                                                                       jti?(jti, token['sub'].to_i)
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34. 
            
            

            

                                                                                     }, iss: ISSUER, verify_iss: true, verify_iat: true, required_claims: %w[iss sub exp jti iat], algorithm: ALGORITHM_TYPE })
          
      35. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    35. 
            
            

            

            
          
      36. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    36. 
            21
            

            

                  raise JWT::InvalidSubError if User.find_by(id: decoded_token[0]['sub']).blank?
          
      37. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    37. 
            
            

            

            
          
      38. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    38. 
            21
            

            

                  ApplicationController.must_be_verified!(decoded_token[0]['sub']) # if not: ApplicationController::InvalidUser::Taboo is risen
          
      39. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    39. 
            
            

            

            
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            21
            

            

                  decoded_token
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

            
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            1
            

            

                def self.forbidden?(token)
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                  # if exists and is explicitly blacklisted .forbidden? is true if token is allowed .forbidden? is false
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                  jti = content(token)
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                  # if .content returns { "status": status, "token": errors } == nil, because {...}[0] == nil
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                  unless jti[0].nil?
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                    return !jti?(jti[0]['jti'],
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

                                 token['sub'].to_i)
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            
            

            

            
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                  # if .jti? finds token identifier blacklisted, it returns true. .forbidden? returns false in this case
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

            
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                  jti # error message from content
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

            
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            1
            

            

                def self.jti(iat)
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                  # creates a unique token identifier (made for application in refresh tokens)
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            23
            

            

                  Digest::MD5.hexdigest([iat.to_s, ISSUER,
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                                         HMAC_SECRET].join(':').to_s)
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

            
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            1
            

            

                def self.jti?(jti, sub = nil)
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

                  # checks whether a specifc (refresh) token is blacklisted (via its identifier "jti")
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            21
            

            

                  !(AuthBlacklist.find_by(token: jti).present? || User.find_by(id: sub).present?)
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

            
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            1
            

            

                def self.must_be_verified_id!(user_id)
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            25
            

            

                  if user_id.class != Integer || !user_id.positive? # is user_id parameter not an integer?
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

                    raise CustomExceptions::InvalidInput::SUB
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

            
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            25
            

            

                  elsif User.find_by(id: user_id).blank? # is the given id referencing an non-existing user?
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                    raise CustomExceptions::InvalidUser::Unknown
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            
            

            

            
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            25
            

            

                  elsif User.find_by(id: user_id).activity_status.zero? # is the user for the given id deactivated?
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            1
            

            

                    raise CustomExceptions::InvalidUser::Inactive
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            
            

            

            
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            24
            

            

                  elsif UserBlacklist.find_by(user_id:).present? # is the user for the given id blacklisted/actively blocked?
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            1
            

            

                    raise CustomExceptions::Unauthorized::Blocked
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            
            

            

            
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            1
            

            

                def self.verify_expiration(man_interval, max, min)
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

                  # is man_interval a positive integer?
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                  raise CustomExceptions::InvalidInput::CustomEXP unless man_interval.instance_of?(Integer) && man_interval.positive?
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            
            

            

            
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            
            

            

                  if man_interval <= max && man_interval >= min # is the given required validity interval not longer than MAX_INTERVAL and not shorter than MIN_INTERVAL?
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            
            

            

                    man_interval # the given required validity interval is sufficient
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

            
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

                  elsif man_interval > max # the given required validity interval is too long, so the token validity interval gets set to MAX_INTERVAL
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                    max
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

            
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                  elsif man_interval < min # the given required validity interval is too short, so the token validity interval gets set to MIN_INTERVAL
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                    min
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

            
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                  # man_interval is no integer or either negative or 0
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

            
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                # TODO: ISSUE #25
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                #     def self.sub?(sub)
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                #       # checks whether a user exists in the database
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                #       if User.find_by(id: sub.to_i).present?
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

                #         true # user is known
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

                #       else
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                #         false # user is unknown
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                #       end
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                #     end
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                # helper class for token generation
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            1
            

            

                class Encoder
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            1
            

            

                  MAX_INTERVAL = 1_209_600 # == 336 hours == 2 weeks
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            1
            

            

                  MIN_INTERVAL = 1800 # == 0.5 hours == 30 min
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

            
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            1
            

            

                  def self.call(user_id, man_interval = nil)
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                    #         if user_id.class != Integer || !user_id.positive? # is user_id parameter not an integer?
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                    #           raise CustomExceptions::InvalidInput::SUB
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                    #         elsif User.find_by(id: user_id).blank? # is the given id referencing an non-existing user?
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                    #           raise CustomExceptions::InvalidUser::Unknown
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                    #         elsif User.find_by(id: user_id).activity_status == 0 # is the user for the given id deactivated?
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                    #           raise CustomExceptions::InvalidUser::Inactive
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                    #
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                    #         elsif UserBlacklist.find_by(user_id: user_id).present? # is the user for the given id blacklisted/actively blocked?
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                    #           raise CustomExceptions::Unauthorized::Blocked
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            25
            

            

                    AuthenticationTokenService::Refresh.must_be_verified_id!(user_id)
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            23
            

            

                    ApplicationController.must_be_verified!(user_id) # if not: ApplicationController::InvalidUser::Taboo is risen
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                    # the given id references an existing user, who is active and not blacklisted
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            23
            

            

                    iat = Time.now.to_i # timestamp
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            23
            

            

                    sub = user_id # who "owns" the token
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

            
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            23
            

            

                    bin_exp = if man_interval.nil? # the man_interval parameter is not given/used
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            23
            

            

                                iat + 14_400 # standard validity interval (4 hours == 240 min == 14400 sec)
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

            
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                              else
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                                #           # the man_interval parameter is given/user -> a manual token expiration time is required
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

                                #           if man_interval.class == Integer && man_interval.positive? # is man_interval a positive integer?
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

                                #
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

                                #             if man_interval <= MAX_INTERVAL && man_interval >= MIN_INTERVAL
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                                # is the given required validity interval not longer than MAX_INTERVAL and not shorter than MIN_INTERVAL?
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                                #               bin_exp = iat + man_interval # the given required validity interval is sufficient
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

                                #
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            
            

            

                                #             elsif man_interval > MAX_INTERVAL # the given required validity interval is too long, so the token validity interval gets set to MAX_INTERVAL
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                                #               bin_exp = iat + MAX_INTERVAL
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                                #
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                                #             elsif man_interval < MIN_INTERVAL # the given required validity interval is too short, so the token validity interval gets set to MIN_INTERVAL
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

                                #               bin_exp = iat + MIN_INTERVAL
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                                #             end
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                                #
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                                #           else
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                                #             # man_interval is no integer or either negative or 0
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

                                #             raise CustomExceptions::InvalidInput::CustomEXP
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                                #           end
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                                iat + AuthenticationTokenService::Refresh.verify_expiration(man_interval, MAX_INTERVAL,
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                                                                                            MIN_INTERVAL)
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

            
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                              end
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            23
            

            

                    exp = bin_exp # placeholder for a standard value or a manually set value
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            23
            

            

                    jti = AuthenticationTokenService::Refresh.jti(iat) # unique token identifier based on the issuing time and the issuer (more info above)
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            23
            

            

                    AuthenticationTokenService::Refresh.encode(sub, exp, jti, iat) # make a refresh token
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

            
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

                # The Decoder class is responsible for decoding refresh tokens.
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            1
            

            

                class Decoder
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            1
            

            

                  def self.call(token)
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            22
            

            

                    raise CustomExceptions::InvalidInput::Token if token.class != String || token.blank?
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

            
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            22
            

            

                    AuthenticationTokenService::Refresh.decode(token)
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173.

              #########################################################
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

              ############### En-/Decoding Access token ###############
          
      176.

              #########################################################
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

              # The Access class is responsible for handling access tokens.
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            1
            

            

              class Access
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            1
            

            

                HMAC_SECRET = ENV.fetch('ACCESS_TOKEN_SECRET', nil)
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            1
            

            

                ALGORITHM_TYPE = 'HS256'
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            1
            

            

                ISSUER = Socket.gethostname
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

            
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            1
            

            

                def self.encode(sub, exp, typ, _scope = nil)
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            21
            

            

                  payload = { sub:, exp:, typ: }
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            21
            

            

                  AuthenticationTokenService.call(
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                    HMAC_SECRET, ALGORITHM_TYPE, ISSUER, payload
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                  )
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

            
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            1
            

            

                def self.decode(token)
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                  # token decoding for an access token
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

                  # this method decodes a jwt token
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            143
            

            

                  JWT.decode(token, HMAC_SECRET, true,
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

                             { iss: ISSUER, verify_iss: true, required_claims: %w[iss sub exp typ], algorithm: ALGORITHM_TYPE })
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

            
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            
            

            

                # The Encoder class is responsible for generating access tokens.
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            1
            

            

                class Encoder
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            1
            

            

                  def self.call(refresh_token)
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            22
            

            

                    AuthenticationTokenService::Refresh::Decoder.call(refresh_token)[0]
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            21
            

            

                    sub = Current.user.id # who "owns" the token
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                    # AuthenticationTokenService::Refresh.must_be_verified_id!(sub)
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

                    # ApplicationController.must_be_verified!(sub)
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            21
            

            

                    typ = User.find_by(id: sub).user_role
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            21
            

            

                    exp = Time.now.to_i + 1200 # standard validity interval;: 1200 sec == 20 min
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            21
            

            

                    AuthenticationTokenService::Access.encode(
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                      sub, exp, typ
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

                    )
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

            
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

                # The Decoder class is responsible for decoding access tokens.
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            1
            

            

                class Decoder
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            1
            

            

                  def self.call(token)
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            143
            

            

                    raise CustomExceptions::InvalidInput::Access::Malformed if token.class != String
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            143
            

            

                    raise CustomExceptions::InvalidInput::Access::Blank if token[0] == ':' || token.blank?
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            
            

            

            
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218.

            # The QuicklinkService class is responsible for handling the server-side authorization
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

            # part of the Embloy application process. It includes two nested classes, Client and Request,
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            
            

            

            # which handle the encoding and decoding of client and request tokens respectively.
          
      6.

            1

                  def self.calculate_expiration(custom_exp, subscription)
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            6
            

            

                    exp = if custom_exp.nil? || custom_exp < Time.now
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            6
            

            

                            Time.now.to_i + (60 * 60 * 24 * 31 * 3) # standard validity interval: 3 months or end of subscription
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                          else
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                            custom_exp.to_i # Set custom expiration date if available
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                          end
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

            
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            6
            

            

                    [exp, subscription.expiration_date.to_i].min # Token can't be valid longer than subscription
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      48.

              def self.update_job_value(job)

    7.

    8.

      9.

                UPDATE jobs
          
      10.

              def self.read_job_value(job = nil)
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            
            

            

                sql = "SELECT ST_AsText(job_value) FROM jobs WHERE job_id=#{job.job_id}"
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                result = ActiveRecord::Base.connection.execute(sql).first
          
      44. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    44. 
            
            

            

                point_string = result['st_astext']
          
      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                latitude, longitude, job_type_id = point_string.scan(/[\d.-]+/)
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            
            

            

                # return the values as a hash
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                { latitude: latitude.to_f,
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                  longitude: longitude.to_f, job_type_id: job_type_id.to_i }
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

            
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            1
            

            

              def self.find_cluster(_job = nil, eps = nil, minpoints = nil)
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            
            

            

                eps = 0.1 if eps.nil?
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            
            

            

                minpoints = 2 if minpoints.nil?
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            
            

            

                sql = <<-SQL
          
      55. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    55. 
            
            

            

                  job_type, ST_ClusterDBSCAN(job_value, eps := #{eps}, minpoints := #{minpoints}) OVER () AS cluster_id,#{' '}
          
      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            
            

            

                  ST_NumGeometries(ST_Collect(job_value)) AS cluster_size#{' '}
          
      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            
            

            

                  FROM jobs#{' '}
          
      58. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    58. 
            
            

            

                  WHERE job_value IS NOT NULL
          
      59. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    59. 
            
            

            

                SQL
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

                clusters = ActiveRecord::Base.connection.execute(sql)
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                clusters.each do |cluster|
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

                  puts "#{cluster.cluster_id}: #{cluster.cluster_size} jobs"
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            
            

            

              end

            # test suite. You never need to work with it otherwise. Remember that
          
      7.

              # @return [Array] sorted array
          
      88.
