            1
            

            

              def self.merge_sort(array, tgt)
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            
            

            

                # klassische Merge sort implementierung mit einem Parameter. Die methode nimmt ein Array mit Hashes an z.b. [{...,start_slot:"07:00:00",target_slot:15,...}] und einen sortierungs parameter (tgt) (z.b. "target_slot"). DIe hashes in array werden nahc diesem sortierparameter soritert.
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            
            

            

            
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

                return array if array.length <= 1
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            
            

            

            
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            
            

            

                array_size = array.length
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            
            

            

                middle = (array.length / 2).round
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            
            

            

            
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

                left_side = array[0...middle]
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            
            

            

                right_side = array[middle...array_size]
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

            
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                sorted_left = merge_sort(left_side, tgt)
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                sorted_right = merge_sort(right_side, tgt)
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

            
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

                merge(array, sorted_left, sorted_right, tgt)
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                array
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

            
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            1
            

            

              def self.merge(array, sorted_left, sorted_right, tgt)
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                left_size = sorted_left.length
          
      108. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    108. 
            
            

            

                right_size = sorted_right.length
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                array_pointer = 0
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                left_pointer = 0
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                right_pointer = 0
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

            
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                while left_pointer < left_size && right_pointer < right_size
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                  if sorted_left[left_pointer].values_at(tgt)[0] < sorted_right[right_pointer].values_at(tgt)[0]
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                    array[array_pointer] = sorted_left[left_pointer]
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                    left_pointer += 1
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            
            

            

                  else
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                    array[array_pointer] = sorted_right[right_pointer]
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                    right_pointer += 1
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                  array_pointer += 1
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

            
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                while left_pointer < left_size
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                  array[array_pointer] = sorted_left[left_pointer]
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

                  left_pointer += 1
          
      127. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    127. 
            
            

            

                  array_pointer += 1
          
      128. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    128. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            
            

            

            
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

                while right_pointer < right_size
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                  array[array_pointer] = sorted_right[right_pointer]
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            
            

            

                  right_pointer += 1
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            
            

            

                  array_pointer += 1
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

            
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            
            

            

                array
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            
            

            

            
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            
            

            

              # Combines binary search with binary compare: Returns index of next largest element in array
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

              # @param array [Array] sorted array
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

              # @param search_item [args] relevant element
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

              # @param tgt [String] search parameter
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            1
            

            

              def self.binary_compare(array, search_item, tgt)
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            
            

            

                low = 0
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            
            

            

                high = array.length - 1
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            
            

            

                return array.length if array[high].values_at(tgt)[0] <= search_item
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

            
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                while high - low > 1
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            
            

            

                  mid = (high + low) / 2
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            
            

            

                  array[mid].values_at(tgt)[0] < search_item ? low = mid + 1 : high = mid
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            
            

            

            
          
      153. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    153. 
            
            

            

                if array[low].values_at(tgt)[0] == search_item
          
      154. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    154. 
            
            

            

                  low + 1
          
      155. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    155. 
            
            

            

                else
          
      156. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    156. 
            
            

            

                  array[high].values_at(tgt)[0] == search_item ? high + 1 : high - 1
          
      157. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    157. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      158. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    158. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      159. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    159. 
            
            

            

            
          
      160. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    160. 
            
            

            

              # Basic linear search to return lower and upper bound of a job array depending on the start_slot with a deviation of +-day (=3600s*24)
          
      161. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    161. 
            
            

            

              # @param array [Array] sorted array of jobs
          
      162. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    162. 
            
            

            

              # @param search_item [Integer] time instance as Interger for reference
          
      163. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    163. 
            
            

            

              # @param tgt [String] search parameter
          
      164. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    164. 
            
            

            

              # @return [[Integer, Integer]] index of lower and upper bound
          
      165. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    165. 
            1
            

            

              def self.time_bounds(array, search_item, tgt)
          
      166. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    166. 
            
            

            

                # puts "INPUT = #{array[0].values_at(tgt)[0].to_i}"
          
      167. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    167. 
            
            

            

                # puts "INPUT = #{array[1].values_at(tgt)[0].to_i}"
          
      168. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    168. 
            
            

            

                # puts "TGT = #{search_item}"
          
      169. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    169. 
            
            

            

                bound = [0, 0]
          
      170. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    170. 
            
            

            

                array.each_with_index do |value, index|
          
      171. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    171. 
            
            

            

                  if value.values_at(tgt)[0].to_i <= search_item - (3600 * 24) - 1
          
      172. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    172. 
            
            

            

                    bound[0] = index + 1
          
      173. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    173. 
            
            

            

                  elsif value.values_at(tgt)[0].to_i <= search_item + (3600 * 24) - 1
          
      174. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    174. 
            
            

            

                    bound[1] = index + 1
          
      175. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    175. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      176. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    176. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      177. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    177. 
            
            

            

                bound
          
      178. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    178. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      179. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    179. 
            
            

            

            
          
      180. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    180. 
            
            

            

              # schaut ob in sorted_args unter target_slot die "zeit id" quivalent zu time ist. es wird das intervall an elementen in sorted_args ausgegeben wo das zutrifft
          
      181. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    181. 
            
            

            

              # @param sorted_args [Array] sorted array of jobs
          
      182. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    182. 
            
            

            

              # @param time [Time] target time
          
      183. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    183. 
            
            

            

              # @return [Array] Interval that matches target time
          
      184. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    184. 
            1
            

            

              def self.find_time(sorted_args, time)
          
      185. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    185. 
            
            

            

                bounds = time_bounds(sorted_args, time.to_i + 1, 'start_slot')
          
      186. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    186. 
            
            

            

                low = bounds[0]
          
      187. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    187. 
            
            

            

                high = bounds[1]
          
      188. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    188. 
            
            

            

            
          
      189. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    189. 
            
            

            

                return [401] if low == -1 || low == sorted_args.length || low >= high
          
      190. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    190. 
            
            

            

            
          
      191. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    191. 
            
            

            

                [low, high - 1]
          
      192. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    192. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

            
          
      194. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    194. 
            
            

            

              # Calculates distance between two coordinates A, B in kilometers
          
      195. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    195. 
            
            

            

              # @param loc1 [[Float, Float]] coordinate A
          
      196. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    196. 
            
            

            

              # @param loc2 [[Float, Float]] coordinate B
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            1
            

            

              def self.distance(loc1, loc2)
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            
            

            

                rad_per_deg = Math::PI / 180 # PI / 180
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            
            

            

                rm = 6371 * 1000 # Earth radius in meters
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

            
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            
            

            

                d_lat_rad = (loc2[0] - loc1[0]) * rad_per_deg # Delta, converted to rad
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                d_lon_rad = (loc2[1] - loc1[1]) * rad_per_deg
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            
            

            

            
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                lat1_rad, = loc1.map { |i| i * rad_per_deg }
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                lat2_rad, = loc2.map { |i| i * rad_per_deg }
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            
            

            

            
          
      207. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    207. 
            
            

            

                a = (Math.sin(d_lat_rad / 2)**2) + (Math.cos(lat1_rad) * Math.cos(lat2_rad) * (Math.sin(d_lon_rad / 2)**2))
          
      208. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    208. 
            
            

            

                c = 2 * Math.atan2(Math.sqrt(a), Math.sqrt(1 - a))
          
      209. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    209. 
            
            

            

            
          
      210. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    210. 
            
            

            

                rm * c # Delta in meters
          
      211. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    211. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      212. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    212. 
            
            

            

            
          
      213. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    213. 
            
            

            

              # schreibt in jeden job aus jobliste die entfernung zwischen user standort und job ort und gibt neue liste aus
          
      214. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    214. 
            
            

            

              # @param user_pos [Hashmap] position of user
          
      215. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    215. 
            
            

            

              # @param args [Job] job list
          
      216. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    216. 
            
            

            

              # @return args job list with updated distance
          
      217. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    217. 
            1
            

            

              def self.calculate_distance(user_pos, args)
          
      218. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    218. 
            
            

            

                user_lat = user_pos.values_at('latitude')[0]
          
      219. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    219. 
            
            

            

                user_lon = user_pos.values_at('longitude')[0]
          
      220. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    220. 
            
            

            

                args.each do |job|
          
      221. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    221. 
            
            

            

                  job_lat = job.values_at('latitude')[0]
          
      222. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    222. 
            
            

            

                  job_lon = job.values_at('longitude')[0]
          
      223. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    223. 
            
            

            

            
          
      224. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    224. 
            
            

            

                  job['distance'] = distance([user_lat, user_lon], [job_lat, job_lon])
          
      225. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    225. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      226. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    226. 
            
            

            

                args
          
      227. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    227. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      228. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    228. 
            
            

            

            
          
      229. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    229. 
            
            

            

              # hashes die nicht die eigenschaften in my_args beschrieben erfllen werden aus args rausgeschmissen
          
      230. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    230. 
            
            

            

              # args = [{},...,{}]
          
      231. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    231. 
            
            

            

              # @param args [Array] array of jobst
          
      232. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    232. 
            
            

            

              # @param my_args [Array] user input
          
      233. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    233. 
            
            

            

              # @return [Array] containing relevant jobs
          
      234. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    234. 
            1
            

            

              def self.match_jobs(args, my_args)
          
      235. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    235. 
            
            

            

                # puts "T1"
          
      236. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    236. 
            
            

            

                time = my_args.select { |k| k.to_s.include? 'time' }.values[0]
          
      237. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    237. 
            
            

            

                args = merge_sort(args, 'start_slot')
          
      238. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    238. 
            
            

            

                rng = find_time(args, time)
          
      239. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    239. 
            
            

            

                # puts "args = #{args}, time = #{time}, \r\n nng = #{rng}"
          
      240. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    240. 
            
            

            

            
          
      241. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    241. 
            
            

            

                # rng = find_time(args, time + 3600 * 24)
          
      242. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    242. 
            
            

            

                if rng == [401] && (rng == [401]) && (rng == [401])
          
      243. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    243. 
            
            

            

                  # rng = find_time(args, time - 3600 * 24)
          
      244. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    244. 
            
            

            

                  return [401]
          
      245. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    245. 
            
            

            

                end
          
      246. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    246. 
            
            

            

            
          
      247. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    247. 
            
            

            

                args = args.slice(rng[0], ((rng[1] + 1) - rng[0]))
          
      248. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    248. 
            
            

            

                merge_sort(calculate_distance(my_args, args), 'distance')
          
      249. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    249. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      250. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    250. 
            
            

            

            
          
      251. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    251. 
            
            

            

              # @param jobs [jobs] input
          
      252. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    252. 
            
            

            

              # @param radius [Float] target radius
          
      253. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    253. 
            
            

            

              # @param limit [Integer] Limit of result
          
      254. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    254. 
            
            

            

              # @return [Array] containing relevant jobs
          
      255. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    255. 
            1
            

            

              def self.generate_feed(jobs, radius, _limit)
          
      256. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    256. 
            
            

            

                return [401] if jobs == [401]
          
      257. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    257. 
            
            

            

            
          
      258. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    258. 
            
            

            

                pos = FeedGenerator.binary_compare(jobs, radius, 'distance')
          
      259. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    259. 
            
            

            

                puts pos
          
      260. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    260. 
            
            

            

            
          
      261. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    261. 
            
            

            

                # No match
          
      262. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    262. 
            
            

            

                return [401] if pos == -1 || jobs[0..pos].empty?
          
      263. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    263. 
            
            

            

            
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            
            

            

                # If number of matched jobs is greater than 'limit', exactly 'limit'-number of jobs will be returned
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            
            

            

                # jobs.slice(0, pos).length > limit ? jobs.slice(0, limit) : jobs.slice(0, pos)
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            
            

            

                jobs[0..pos]
          
      267. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    267. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      268. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    268. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      269.

            # Requires supporting ruby files with custom matchers and macros, etc, in
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

            # spec/support/ and its subdirectories. Files matching `spec/**/*_spec.rb` are
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

            # run as spec files by default. This means that files in spec/support that end
          
      15.

            # in _spec.rb will both be required and run as specs, causing the specs to be
          
      16.

            # run twice. It is recommended that you do not name files matching this glob to

            # Checks for pending migrations and applies them before tests are run.
          
      28. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    28. 
            
            

            

            # If you are not using ActiveRecord, you can remove these lines.
          
      29. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    29. 
            
            

            

            begin
          
      30.

            1
            

            

              ActiveRecord::Migration.maintain_test_schema!
          
      31. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    31. 
            
            

            

            rescue ActiveRecord::PendingMigrationError => e
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            
            

            

              abort e.to_s.strip
          
      33. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    33. 
            
            

            

            end
          
      34. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    34.

                ### ACCESS / REFRESH TOKENS ###

                # Verified user refresh/access tokens
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            1
            

            

                credentials = Base64.strict_encode64("#{@valid_user.email}:password")
          
      51. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    51. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'Authorization' => "Basic #{credentials}" }
          
      52. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    52. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/refresh', headers:)
          
      53. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    53. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_refresh_token = JSON.parse(response.body)['refresh_token']
          
      54. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    54. 
            1

      56. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    56. 
            1

      57. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    57. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/access', headers:)

            1

    144.

    spec/requests/api/v0/authentication_controller_spec.rb

    100.0% lines covered

    94 relevant lines. 94 lines covered and 0 lines missed. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    1. 
            
            

            

            # frozen_string_literal: true
          
      2. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    2. 
            
            

            

            
          
      3. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    3. 
            1
            

            

            require 'rails_helper'
          
      4. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    4. 
            
            

            

            
          
      5. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    5. 
            1
            

            

            RSpec.describe 'AuthenticationController' do
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            1
            

            

              before(:all) do

                @valid_rt = JSON.parse(response.body)['refresh_token']

                puts "Valid user with upcoming jobs refresh token: #{@valid_rt}"

      27. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    27. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'HTTP_REFRESH_TOKEN' => @valid_rt }

            # frozen_string_literal: true

            require 'rails_helper'

            1
            

            

            RSpec.describe 'PasswordResetsController' do
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            1
            

            

              before(:all) do
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            1
            

            

                charset = ('a'..'z').to_a + ('A'..'Z').to_a
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

            
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_user = User.create!(
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

                  first_name: 'Max',
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                  last_name: 'Mustermann',
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            17
            

            

                  email: "#{(0...16).map { charset.sample }.join}@embloy.com",
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                  password: 'password',
          
      14.

    16.

    17. 
            
            

            

                )
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Created valid user: #{@valid_user.id}"

                )
          
      40. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    40. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Created blacklisted user: #{@blacklisted_user.id}"
          
      41. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    41. 
            
            

            

            
          
      42. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    42. 
            1
            

            

                UserBlacklist.create!(
          
      43. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    43. 
            
            

            

                  user_id: @blacklisted_user.id,
          
      44.

      45. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    45. 
            
            

            

                )
          
      46. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    46. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_reset_token = @valid_user.signed_id(
          
      47. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    47. 
            
            

            

                  purpose: 'password_reset', expires_in: 15.minutes
          
      48. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    48. 
            
            

            

                )
          
      49. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    49. 
            1
            

            

                @unverified_reset_token = @unverified_user.signed_id(
          
      50. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    50. 
            
            

            

                  purpose: 'password_reset', expires_in: 15.minutes
          
      51.

                )

            1

      57.

                )

      60.

    61. 
            1
            

            

                @invalid_reset_token = 'eyJfcmFpbHMiOnsibWVzc2FnZSI6Ik1RPT0iLCJleHAiOiIyMDIzLTEyLTI2VDE3OjQ0OjU4LjA3OFoiLCJwdXIiOiJ1c2VyL3Bhc3N3b3JkX3Jlc2V0In19--d57cad3e713b4008c450fd9d13e5f992e64e9a65d8cc06731a92f14309f7c213'
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            
            

            

              end
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            
            

            

            
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            1
            

            

              describe 'Reset password', type: :request do
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            1
            

            

                describe '(PATCH: /api/v0/user/password/reset)' do
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            1
            

            

                  context 'valid inputs' do
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [202 Accepted] and initiates the password reset process for valid user' do
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            1
            

            

                      headers = { 'Content-Type' => 'application/json' }
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            1
            

            

                      post("/api/v0/user/password/reset?email=#{@valid_user.email}", headers:)
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(202)
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [202 Accepted] and initiates the password reset process for unverified user' do
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            1
            

            

                      headers = { 'Content-Type' => 'application/json' }
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            1

      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(202)
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [202 Accepted] for trying to reset password of non-existing user' do
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            1

      79.

            1

      81.

      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            1

            1

            1

      99.

            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [200 OK] and resets the user\'s password' do
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            1
            

            

                      data = JSON.dump({
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            
            

            

                                         user: {
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102.

    107. 
            1

    108. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(200)
          
      109.

                # Verified user refresh/access/client tokens
          
      32. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    32. 
            1
            

            

                credentials = Base64.strict_encode64("#{@valid_user.email}:password")

    33. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'Authorization' => "Basic #{credentials}" }

    34. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/refresh', headers:)

    35. 
            1

                      headers = { 'HTTP_ACCESS_TOKEN' => @valid_at_blacklisted, 'Content-Type' => 'application/json' }
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            1
            

            

                      patch('/api/v0/user/password', params: data, headers:)
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(403)
          
      136.

                    end

                ### ACCESS / REFRESH TOKENS ###
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            
            

            

            
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            
            

            

                # Verified user refresh/access/client tokens
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            1
            

            

                credentials = Base64.strict_encode64("#{@valid_user.email}:password")
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'Authorization' => "Basic #{credentials}" }
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/refresh', headers:)
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_refresh_token = JSON.parse(response.body)['refresh_token']
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user refresh token: #{@valid_refresh_token}"
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            
            

            

            
          
      138. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    138. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'HTTP_REFRESH_TOKEN' => @valid_refresh_token }
          
      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/access', headers:)
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_access_token = JSON.parse(response.body)['access_token']
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user access token: #{@valid_access_token}"
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            
            

            

            
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'HTTP_ACCESS_TOKEN' => @valid_access_token }
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/client/auth/token', headers:)
          
      145. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    145. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_client_token = JSON.parse(response.body)['client_token']
          
      146. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    146. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user client token: #{@valid_client_token}"
          
      147. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    147. 
            
            

            

            
          
      148. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    148. 
            
            

            

                # Verified user with soon expiring subscription refresh/access/client tokens
          
      149. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    149. 
            1
            

            

                credentials = Base64.strict_encode64("#{@valid_user_exp.email}:password")
          
      150. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    150. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'Authorization' => "Basic #{credentials}" }
          
      151. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    151. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/refresh', headers:)
          
      152. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    152. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_rt_exp = JSON.parse(response.body)['refresh_token']
          
      153.

            1

            1
            

            

                5.times do

            5
            

            

                  application = Application.create!(

              describe 'Quicklink', type: :request do

            1
            

            

                describe '(POST: /api/v0/client/auth/token)' do
          
      264. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    264. 
            1
            

            

                  context 'valid normal inputs' do
          
      265. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    265. 
            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [200 Ok] and new client token' do
          
      266. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    266. 
            1
            

            

                      headers = { 'HTTP_ACCESS_TOKEN' => @valid_access_token }
          
      267.

            1
            

            

                      post('/api/v0/client/auth/token', headers:)

            1
            

            

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(200)
          
      269.

                    end
          
      270. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    270. 
            1

            1
            

            

                  context 'invalid inputs' do

    277. 
            1

            1

      279.

            1

                    end

            1

            1

            1

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(400)

                    end     
          
      312. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    312. 
            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [401 Unauthorized] for expired/invalid client token' do
          
      313.

            1
            

            

                      headers = { 'HTTP_CLIENT_TOKEN' => @invalid_token }
          
      314.

            1
            

            

                      post('/api/v0/sdk/request/auth/token', headers:)
          
      315.

            1
            

            

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(401)
          
      316.

                    end
          
      317. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    317. 
            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [403 Forbidden] for blacklisted user' do
          
      318. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    318. 
            1
            

            

                      headers = { 'HTTP_CLIENT_TOKEN' => @valid_ct_blacklisted }
          
      319. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    319. 
            1
            

            

                      post('/api/v0/sdk/request/auth/token', headers:)

                ### ACCESS / REFRESH TOKENS ###
          
      60. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    60. 
            
            

            

            
          
      61. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    61. 
            
            

            

                # Verified user refresh/access tokens
          
      62. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    62. 
            1
            

            

                credentials = Base64.strict_encode64("#{@valid_user.email}:password")
          
      63. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    63. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'Authorization' => "Basic #{credentials}" }
          
      64. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    64. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/refresh', headers:)
          
      65. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    65. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_refresh_token = JSON.parse(response.body)['refresh_token']
          
      66. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    66. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user refresh token: #{@valid_refresh_token}"
          
      67. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    67. 
            
            

            

            
          
      68. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    68. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'HTTP_REFRESH_TOKEN' => @valid_refresh_token }
          
      69. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    69. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/access', headers:)
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_access_token = JSON.parse(response.body)['access_token']
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user access token: #{@valid_access_token}"
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

            
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                # Verified user with subscriptions refresh/access tokens
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            1
            

            

                credentials = Base64.strict_encode64("#{@valid_user_has_subscriptions.email}:password")
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'Authorization' => "Basic #{credentials}" }
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/refresh', headers:)
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_rt_has_subscriptions = JSON.parse(response.body)['refresh_token']
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user with subscriptions refresh token: #{@valid_rt_has_subscriptions}"
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

            
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'HTTP_REFRESH_TOKEN' => @valid_rt_has_subscriptions }
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/access', headers:)
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_at_has_subscriptions = JSON.parse(response.body)['access_token']
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user access token: #{@valid_at_has_subscriptions}"
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

            
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                # Blacklisted user refresh/access/client tokens
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            1
            

            

                credentials = Base64.strict_encode64("#{@blacklisted_user.email}:password")
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'Authorization' => "Basic #{credentials}" }
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/refresh', headers:)
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_rt_blacklisted = JSON.parse(response.body)['refresh_token']
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user who will be blacklisted refresh token: #{@valid_rt_blacklisted}"
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

            
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'HTTP_REFRESH_TOKEN' => @valid_rt_blacklisted }
          
      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/access', headers:)
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_at_blacklisted = JSON.parse(response.body)['access_token']
          
      95. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    95. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user who will be blacklisted access token: #{@valid_at_blacklisted}"
          
      96. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    96. 
            
            

            

            
          
      97. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    97. 
            1
            

            

                UserBlacklist.create!(
          
      98. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    98. 
            
            

            

                  user_id: @blacklisted_user.id,
          
      99. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    99. 
            
            

            

                  reason: 'Test blacklist'
          
      100. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    100. 
            
            

            

                )
          
      101. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    101. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Blacklisted user #{@blacklisted_user.id}}"
          
      102. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    102. 
            
            

            

            
          
      103. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    103. 
            
            

            

                # Invalid/expired access tokens
          
      104. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    104. 
            1
            

            

                @invalid_access_token = 'eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiJ9.eyJzdWILOjQ6LCJleHAiOjE2OTgxNzk0MjgsImp0aSI6IjQ1NDMyZWUyNWE4YWUyMjc1ZGY0YTE2ZTNlNmQ0YTY4IiwiaWF0IjoxNjk4MTY1MDI4LCJpc3MiOiJDQl9TdXJmYWNlUHJvOCJ9.nqGgQ6Z52CbaHZzPGcwQG6U-nMDxb1yIe7HQMxjoDTs'
          
      105. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    105. 
            
            

            

            
          
      106. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    106. 
            
            

            

                # SUBSCRIPTIONS
          
      107. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    107. 
            
            

            

                # Create subscriptions for valid verified user (valid_user_has_subscriptions)

    108. 
            1
            

            

                @forbidden_subscription = Subscription.create!(
          
      109. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    109. 
            
            

            

                  user_id: @blacklisted_user.id,
          
      110. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    110. 
            
            

            

                  tier: 'basic',
          
      111. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    111. 
            
            

            

                  active: true,
          
      112. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    112. 
            
            

            

                  expiration_date: Time.now,
          
      113. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    113. 
            
            

            

                  start_date: Time.now,
          
      114. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    114. 
            
            

            

                  auto_renew: true,
          
      115. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    115. 
            
            

            

                  start_date: Time.now
          
      116. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    116. 
            
            

            

                )
          
      117. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    117. 
            1
            

            

                @subscription = Subscription.create!(
          
      118. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    118. 
            
            

            

                  user_id: @valid_user_has_subscriptions.id,
          
      119. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    119. 
            
            

            

                  tier: 'basic',
          
      120. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    120. 
            
            

            

                  active: true,
          
      121. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    121. 
            
            

            

                  expiration_date: Time.now,
          
      122. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    122. 
            
            

            

                  start_date: Time.now,
          
      123. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    123. 
            
            

            

                  auto_renew: true,
          
      124. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    124. 
            
            

            

                  start_date: Time.now
          
      125. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    125. 
            
            

            

                )
          
      126. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    126. 
            
            

            

              end

            1
            

            

              describe 'Subscription', type: :request do
          
      129. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    129. 
            1
            

            

                describe '(GET: /api/v0/client/subscriptions)' do
          
      130. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    130. 
            1
            

            

                  context 'valid normal inputs' do
          
      131. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    131. 
            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [200 Ok] and JSON job JSONs if user has subscriptions' do
          
      132. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    132. 
            1
            

            

                      headers = { 'HTTP_ACCESS_TOKEN' => @valid_at_has_subscriptions }
          
      133. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    133. 
            1
            

            

                      get('/api/v0/client/subscriptions', headers:)
          
      134. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    134. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(200)
          
      135. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    135. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      136. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    136. 
            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [204 No Content] if user does not have any subscriptions' do
          
      137. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    137. 
            1
            

            

                      headers = { 'HTTP_ACCESS_TOKEN' => @valid_access_token }

    138. 
            1

      139. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    139. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(204)
          
      140. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    140. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      141. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    141. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      142. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    142. 
            1
            

            

                  context 'invalid inputs' do
          
      143. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    143. 
            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [400 Bad Request] for missing access token in header' do
          
      144. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    144. 
            1

      145.

            1

            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [404 Not Found] for non existing subscription' do

            1
            

            

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(404)

                    end
          
      193. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    193. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      194.

                end

      196.

            1
            

            

                describe '(POST: /api/v0/client/subscriptions)' do
          
      197. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    197. 
            1
            

            

                  context 'valid normal inputs' do
          
      198. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    198. 
            1
            

            

                    it 'returns [201 Created] and creates new subscription' do
          
      199. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    199. 
            1
            

            

                      body = { subscription: { tier: 'basic', active: true, expiration_date: '2024-11-19T06:16:09.000Z',
          
      200. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    200. 
            
            

            

                                               start_date: '2024-11-19T06:16:09.000Z', auto_renew: true } }
          
      201. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    201. 
            1
            

            

                      post '/api/v0/client/subscriptions', params: body.to_json,
          
      202. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    202. 
            
            

            

                                                           headers: { 'Content-Type' => 'application/json', 'HTTP_ACCESS_TOKEN' => @valid_access_token }
          
      203. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    203. 
            1
            

            

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(201)
          
      204. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    204. 
            
            

            

                    end
          
      205. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    205. 
            
            

            

                  end
          
      206. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    206. 
            1
            

            

                  context 'invalid inputs' do

            1

            1

    209. 
            
            

            

                                               start_date: '2024-11-19T06:16:09.000Z', auto_renew: true } }

            1

            1
            

            

                      expect(response).to have_http_status(400)

      249.

    284 relevant lines. 284 lines covered and 0 lines missed.

      3.

            1
            

            

            require 'rails_helper'

    5. 
            1
            

            

            RSpec.describe 'UserController' do
          
      6. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    6. 
            1
            

            

              before(:all) do
          
      7. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    7. 
            1
            

            

                charset = ('a'..'z').to_a + ('A'..'Z').to_a
          
      8. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    8. 
            
            

            

            
          
      9. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    9. 
            
            

            

                ### USER CREATION ###
          
      10. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    10. 
            
            

            

            
          
      11. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    11. 
            
            

            

                # Create valid verified user without own jobs, upcoming jobs, reviews, ...
          
      12. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    12. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_user = User.create!(
          
      13. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    13. 
            
            

            

                  first_name: 'Max',
          
      14. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    14. 
            
            

            

                  last_name: 'Mustermann',
          
      15. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    15. 
            17
            

            

                  email: "#{(0...16).map { charset.sample }.join}@embloy.com",
          
      16. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    16. 
            
            

            

                  password: 'password',
          
      17. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    17. 
            
            

            

                  password_confirmation: 'password',
          
      18. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    18. 
            
            

            

                  user_role: 'verified',
          
      19. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    19. 
            
            

            

                  activity_status: '1'
          
      20. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    20. 
            
            

            

                )
          
      21. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    21. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Created verified user without own jobs, upcoming jobs, reviews: #{@valid_user.id}"
          
      22. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    22. 
            
            

            

            
          
      23. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    23.

            1
            

            

                puts "Created blacklisted user: #{@blacklisted_user.id}"
          
      70. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    70. 
            
            

            

            
          
      71. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    71. 
            
            

            

                ### ACCESS / REFRESH TOKENS ###
          
      72. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    72. 
            
            

            

            
          
      73. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    73. 
            
            

            

                # Verified user refresh/access tokens
          
      74. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    74. 
            1
            

            

                credentials = Base64.strict_encode64("#{@valid_user.email}:password")
          
      75. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    75. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'Authorization' => "Basic #{credentials}" }
          
      76. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    76. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/refresh', headers:)
          
      77. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    77. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_refresh_token = JSON.parse(response.body)['refresh_token']
          
      78. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    78. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user refresh token: #{@valid_refresh_token}"
          
      79. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    79. 
            
            

            

            
          
      80. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    80. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'HTTP_REFRESH_TOKEN' => @valid_refresh_token }
          
      81. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    81. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/access', headers:)
          
      82. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    82. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_access_token = JSON.parse(response.body)['access_token']
          
      83. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    83. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user access token: #{@valid_access_token}"
          
      84. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    84. 
            
            

            

            
          
      85. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    85. 
            
            

            

                # Valid user with own jobs refresh/access tokens
          
      86. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    86. 
            1
            

            

                credentials = Base64.strict_encode64("#{@valid_user_has_own_jobs.email}:password")
          
      87. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    87. 
            1
            

            

                headers = { 'Authorization' => "Basic #{credentials}" }
          
      88. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    88. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/refresh', headers:)
          
      89. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    89. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_rt_has_own_jobs = JSON.parse(response.body)['refresh_token']
          
      90. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    90. 
            1
            

            

                puts "Valid user with own jobs refresh token: #{@valid_rt_has_own_jobs}"
          
      91. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    91. 
            
            

            

            
          
      92. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    92. 
            1

      93. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    93. 
            1
            

            

                post('/api/v0/user/auth/token/access', headers:)
          
      94. 
        
      
      
        
      
          
    94. 
            1
            

            

                @valid_at_has_own_jobs = JSON.parse(response.body)['access_token']
          
      95.

            1

      96.

      100.

      118.

      119.
